subject: Productivity
title: Anchoring Effect
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Anchoring Effect.

hook.text: A car dealer lists a car at $30,000. You negotiate down to $25,000 and feel smart. The car is worth $20,000.

buildup.text: Anchoring occurs when the first number you hear influences all subsequent judgments.

discovery.text: Tversky and Kahneman showed that even random numbers affect estimates of unrelated quantities.

twist.text: Knowing about anchoring doesn't fully protect you. The effect persists even when people are warned.

climax.text: In negotiations, the person who names the first number often controls the final outcome.

punchline.text: The first number sets the game. Choose it wisely.

quiz.question: What is the anchoring effect?
options: The first number heard influences all later judgments
People always choose the lowest option
